cyclone.name: CINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 305 miles south of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then turning north-northwest and slowing while tracking toward the central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Intracoastal City–Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: west of Intracoastal City, LA to High Island, TX (includes upper Texas coast near Beaumont)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: central and eastern Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, western Florida Panhandle, with fringe impacts possible on the upper Texas coast
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (1–2 ft possible along upper TX coast)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible Wednesday through early Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft along the upper Texas coast including Sabine Pass
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated higher totals in feeder bands Wednesday-Thursday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands mainly east of Beaumont
